other_tests.findings: Scans reveal a pigtail drainage catheter in place in the right lobe of the liver with a small residual pocket of complex fluid measuring approximately 2.4 x 4.4 x 4.0 cm. The remainder of the liver is normal with no other fluid collections or evidence of bile duct dilatation. The portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The residual pocket of fluid is much smaller than the abscess at the time of drainage, which measured approximately 6.3 x 11.4 cm.
